gfxeditor

Class Shape

  • java.lang.Object
    • gfxeditor.Shape
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Circle, Decorator, ImageAdapter, Line, Oval, Rectangle, Square, Triangle

    public abstract class Shape
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    This is the abstract shape that is "produced" by the factories and cloned by the prototypes. The view representing the model only needs to take care of this abstract base class.

    Note: This abstract class does not store how the actual shape looks like, i.e., you have to take care of that. Don't forget to use the properties that are stored in this class, or, in case you don't need some of them, at least override the getters and setters, so that its behavior is predictable.
    In most cases, you will store the actual shape as a java.awt.geom object; if the size or the position (x,y) of the Shape object is changed, its geometry object (stored in the derived class) also needs to be updated.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Shape(int x, int y, java.awt.Color color)
      Constructs a generic shape with a width and height of 0, a border/line width of 0 and with black border color.

        public void setPosition(java.awt.Point p)

      • setSize

        public abstract void setSize(int width,
                             int height)
        Sets the width and height of this shape.

        Note: This should be the method that creates the internal geometric representation of the actual shape, as it's called by the constructor and the setters of Shape.

        Parameters:
        width - The new width of the shape, in pixels
        height - The new height of the shape, in pixels

      • getWidth

        Returns:

        Returns the height of this shape.
        Returns:
        The height of the shape

      • setToDefaults

        public abstract void setToDefaults()
        Sets this shape's properties to their default values.

        Note: Preferably, this method only calls setSize(int, int) with default values.

      • paint

        public abstract void paint(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Paints the actual shape using its internal geometric representation. This is a delegate method for the application's canvas.
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics context where the shape is to be painted
        See Also:
        Container.paintComponents(java.awt.Graphics)

      • contains

        public abstract boolean contains(java.awt.Point p)
        Checks if a point is contained in this shape.

        Note: This method should delegate the task to contains(Point) of the internal geometric representation.

        Parameters:
        p - The position where a mouse button has been pressed
        Returns:
        true if the point is within the actual shape

      • isInvisible

        public abstract boolean isInvisible()
        Checks if the shape is not visible when paint(Graphics2D) is called. This is most likely the case if the shape's width or height is less than or equal to 0, but it depends on the geometric representation.
        Returns:
        true if the actual shape is not visible when painted

      • getNumber

        public abstract int getNumber()
        Returns the internal number of this shape.
        Returns:
        The internal number
        Since:
        2.0
